item.title: Docker Volume Permissions with SELinux
item.description: Unfamiliar with running Docker on a SELinux enabled system, I found myself running into a bunch of file permission errors while creating volumes. mkdir: can't create directory '/data': Permission denied $ docker info --format '{{json .SecurityOptions}}' [ "name=seccomp,profile=/etc/docker/seccomp.json", "name=selinux" ] It turns out that this can be resolved by appending the :z flag to the volume mappings in the docker-compose.yml file, indicating that the volume content is shared. services: server: volumes: - .
